subLabel.preValidation: Configure the virtual machine's resources and settings

elements.name: vmName
elements.label: Virtual machine name
elements.toolTip: Virtual machines in Azure have two distinct names: virtual machine name used as the Azure resource identifier, and in guest host name. When you create a VM in the portal, the same name is used for both the virtual machine name and the host name. The virtual machine name cannot be changed after the VM is created. You can change the host name when you log into the virtual machine.

constraints.validationMessage: Virtual machine name must be between 3 and 15 characters long and contain letters, numbers and hyphens only.

elements.name: availabilityOptions
elements.label: Availability options
elements.toolTip: Azure offers a range of options for managing availability and resiliency for your applications. Architect your solution to use replicated VMs in Availability Sets to protect your apps and data from datacenter outages and maintenance events.

elements.name: availabilitySetName
elements.label: Availability set name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Availability set.

constraints.validationMessage: Availability set name must be between 3 and 15 characters long and contain letters, numbers and hyphens only.

elements.name: instanceCount
elements.label: Instance count
elements.toolTip: Number of virtual machines in the availability set.

elements.name: faultDomains
elements.label: Fault domains
elements.toolTip: Virtual machines in the same fault domain share a common power source and physical network switch.

elements.name: updateDomains
elements.label: Update domains
elements.toolTip: Virtual machines in the same update domain will be restarted together during planned maintenance. Azure never restarts more than one update domain at a time.

elements.name: osVersion
elements.label: Windows OS version
elements.toolTip: The OS version for the VM Image

elements.name: vmSize
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Select a VM size to support the workload that you want to run. The size that you choose then determines factors such as processing power, memory, and storage capacity. Azure offers a wide variety of sizes to support many types of uses. Azure charges an hourly price based on the VM's size and operating system.

elements.name: adminUsername
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Admin username for the virtual machine.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

toolTip.password: The administrator password for the VM

constraints.customValidationMessage: Password must be at least 12 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol

elements.name: enableHybridBenefit
elements.label: Would you like to use an existing Windows Server license?
elements.toolTip: If you own Windows licenses with active Software Assurance (SA) or have an active Windows Server subscription, use Azure Hybrid Benefit to save compute cost.

elements.name: enableMultisession
elements.label: I confirm I have an eligible Windows 10 license with multi-tenant hosting rights.
elements.toolTip: Review multi-tenant hosting rights for Windows 10 compliance.

subLabel.preValidation: Configure the virtual machine's resources and settings

elements.name: osDiskStorageType
elements.label: OS disk type
elements.toolTip: You can choose between Azure managed disks types to support your workload or scenario.

elements.name: osDiskEncryptionType
elements.label: Encryption type
elements.toolTip: Select the encryption type for OS disk.
elements.defaultValue: (Default) Encryption at-rest with a platform-managed key

allowedValues.label: (Default) Encryption at-rest with a platform-managed key
Encryption at-rest with a customer-managed key
Double encryption with platform-managed and customer-managed keys

elements.name: osDiskEncryptionSet
elements.label: Disk encryption set
elements.toolTip: A disk encryption set stores the customer key that a disk or snapshot will use for encrypting its data. You must choose an existing disk encryption set during this step. Disk encryption sets require access to key vault and keys.

subLabel.preValidation: Define network connectivity for your virtual machine by configuring network interface card (NIC) settings. You can control ports, inbound and outbound connectivity with security group rules, or place behind an existing load balancing solution.

toolTip.virtualNetwork: Virtual networks are logically isolated from each other in Azure. You can configure their IP address ranges, subnets, route tables, gateways, and security settings, much like a traditional network in your data center. Virtual machines in the same virtual network can access each other by default.
toolTip.subnets: A subnet is a range of IP addresses in your virtual network, which can be used to isolate virtual machines from each other or from the Internet.

elements.name: vmApplicationSecurityGroup
elements.label: Application security group
elements.toolTip: Application security groups enable you to configure network security as a natural extension of an application's structure, allowing you to group virtual machines and define network security policies based on those groups.

subLabel.preValidation: Configure monitoring and management options for your VM.

elements.name: diagnosticStorageAccount
elements.label: Storage account
elements.toolTip: Storage Account for Diagnostic Settings.

elements.name: logAnalyticsWorkspace
elements.label: Log Analytics workspace
elements.toolTip: Log Analytics workspace for Diagnostic Settings.

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a port number between 1024 and 65535.

elements.name: sqlAuthentication
elements.label: SQL Authentication
elements.toolTip: Enable SQL Authentication for connecting to SQL Server.

elements.name: sqlAuthenticationLogin
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Enter the SQL Authentication login you will use to connect to SQL Server. The sysadmin role will be assigned to this login.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

toolTip.password: Enter the password associated with the SQL Authentication login. The password for the SQL Authentication login is auto-filled with the admin user password you entered for the virtual machine.

constraints.customValidationMessage: Password must be at least 12 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol

elements.name: keyVaultIntegration
elements.label: Azure Key Vault integration
elements.toolTip: Configure your virtual machine to be able to connect to the Azure Key Vault service.

elements.name: kvUrl
elements.label: Key Vault URL
elements.toolTip: Key Vault URL should be in the format of 'https://{keyvaultname}.vault.usgovcloudapi.net'

elements.name: kvPrincipalName
elements.label: Principal name
elements.toolTip: Enter the client id of the application registered with Microsoft Azure Active Directory that needs access to the Azure Key Vault.

toolTip.password: Enter the key that was generated for the application after it was registered with Microsoft Azure Active Directory.

constraints.customValidationMessage: Password must be at least 12 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol

elements.name: kvCredentialName
elements.label: Credential name
elements.toolTip: Azure Key Vault Integration creates a credential within SQL Server, allowing the virtual machine to have access to the key vault. Choose a name for this credential.

elements.name: enableHybridBenefitSqlLicense
elements.label: SQL Server License
elements.toolTip: If you have SQL Server licenses with Software Assurance (SA) or a SQL Server subscription, use Azure Hybrid Benefit to save.

elements.name: automatedPatching
elements.label: Automated patching
elements.toolTip: Set a patching window during which all Windows and SQL patches will be applied.

elements.name: maintenanceScheduleDay
elements.label: Maintenance Schedule
elements.toolTip: Select the day(s) during which patching can take place.

elements.name: patchingDuration
elements.label: Maintenance window duration (minutes)
elements.toolTip: Number of virtual machines in the availability set.

elements.name: sqlAutomatedBackup
elements.label: Automated backup
elements.toolTip: Configure backups for databases in your virtual machine.

elements.name: sqlAutobackupStorageAccountName
elements.label: Storage account
elements.toolTip: Storage Account for Automated Backup.

toolTip.password: Your encryption certificate will be protected by this password. Be sure to remember it.

constraints.customValidationMessage: Password must be at least 12 characters long, and contain upper case, lower case, number and symbol

elements.name: systemDatabaseBackup
elements.label: Backup system databases
elements.toolTip: Take full backups of Master, Model, and MSDB

elements.name: backupScheduleType
elements.label: Configure backup schedule
elements.toolTip: Take full backups of Master, Model, and MSDB

elements.name: fullBackupFrequency
elements.label: Backup frequency
elements.toolTip: Daily - Take full backups every day at the specified start time. Weekly - Take full backups every week beginning at the next specified start time

elements.name: rServices
elements.label: SQL Server Machine Learning Services (In-Database)
elements.toolTip: Enables SQL Server R Services, allowing you to utilize advanced analytics within your SQL Server. R Services is only supported with SQL Server 2016 (except Express edition).
